alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Caddo; Canadian; Custer (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 12:28AM CDT until June 05 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Canadian River near Bridgeport affecting Custer, Caddo, Canadian and Blaine Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Canadian River near Bridgeport. * WHEN...From early this morning to Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Some brief flooding may occur over croplands and pastures near the river in southern Blaine... northern Caddo... and southwestern Canadian counties. Low-lying bottomlands near the river may be cut off from easy access by high water in side channels. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7 PM Friday evening, the river was estimated at 10.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The Canadian River is expected to rise to a crest of 12.6 feet just after midnight tonight (Sunday morning). - Action stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 1230 PM CDT.
